physdesc.extent: 1 record carton that contains 11 VHS tapes, 3 cassettes, 3 reels, 20 slides, 1 3.5" floppy, 1 CD-ROM.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection may require review before it is available for use. Please contact DCA for further details.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is not yet organized.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Raoul Bott was born in Budapest, Hungary on September 24, 1923. His family emigrated to Canada in 1938, and subsequently he served in the Canadian Army in Europe during World War II. Bott later went to college at McGill University in Montreal, where he studied electrical engineering. He then earned a Ph.D. in mathematics from Carnegie Mellon University in Pittsburgh in 1949. Afterward, he began teaching at the University of Michigan in Ann Arbor. He was a professor at Harvard University from 1959 to 1999. He died in Carlsbad, California on December 21, 2005.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: Donated by Bott's daughter. Content retrieved from one mini cd, but floppy disk was not immediately readable.

processinfo.head: Processing status
processinfo.p: This collection is minimally processed and may not be available for research

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains Bott's Ph.D. thesis and media documenting his lectures and appearances.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Some material in this collection may be protected by copyright and other rights. Please see "Reproductions and Use" on the Digital Collections and Archives website for more information about reproductions and permission to publish. No documentation is available regarding the intellectual property rights in this collection.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Items are closed due to copyright and are in the Dark Archive.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains publications by Kiyoshi Igusa with ancillary materials, which are closed due to copyright.

physdesc.extent: Zip file contains four files: MMMK004.pdf, MMMK004.ps, MIT03.pdf, MMMK004.dvi.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Publications and ancillary materials by Kiyoshi Igusa.
